title: Debra Elmegreen - Poughkeepsie, New York, United States | Professional Profile | LinkedIn
snippet: Associate Professor at Dartmouth College and Amazon Visiting Academic at AWS. Researcher and educator in quantum information science.

title: Debra Elmegreen - Wikipedia
snippet: Elmegreen was born in South Bend, Indiana in 1952. She became interested in astronomy at a young age. She received her bachelor's degree in astrophysics from the Princeton University in 1975, where she was the first woman to graduate with an astrophysics major.

title: Debra Elmegreen - 1400 Degrees
snippet: She was the first woman to graduate with an undergraduate degree in Astrophysical Sciences from Princeton University. She received her PhD in Astronomy from Harvard University, and was the first woman to hold a Carnegie Postdoctoral Fellowship.

title: Debra M. Elmegreen | Vassar College
snippet: Vassarâ€™s first professor, astronomer Maria Mitchell and Debra Elmegreen, Professor of Astronomy on the Maria Mitchell Chair and Department Chair, were the subjects of a Chronicle of Higher Education story.

title: In the Footsteps of Maria Mitchell - Professor Debra M. Elmegreen ...
snippet: Elmegreen has been on the Vassar faculty since 1985, teaching astronomy at all levels. She received her undergraduate degree in astrophysics from Princeton University (the first woman to do so) and her MA and PhD in Astronomy from Harvard University.
